question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-bytecode-verifier/bytecode-verifier-tests/src/unit_tests/code_unit_tests.rs] [Verifier integration] Does the test suite verify that error locations (major_status) are precisely reported, or can error masking hide root causes of verification failures? (Low)

(High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-bytecode-verifier/bytecode-verifier-tests/src/unit_tests/code_unit_tests.rs] [Error handling] Are there other StatusCode values that should fail these tests but aren't checked, indicating gaps in error classification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-bytecode-verifier/bytecode-verifier-tests/src/unit_tests/code_unit_tests.rs] [Error handling] Can assert! and assert_eq! in tests be optimized away in release builds, causing verification to silently succeed on invalid input? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-bytecode-verifier/bytecode-verifier-tests/src/unit_tests/code_unit_tests.rs] [Configuration] Can VerifierConfig with max_basic_blocks: Some(16) be bypassed by modules that split blocks differently to stay under the limit while achieving high complexity? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-bytecode-verifier/bytecode-verifier-tests/src/unit_tests/code_unit_tests.rs] [Configuration] Does Default::default() for VerifierConfig provide secure defaults, or can default configuration allow DoS attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-bytecode-verifier/bytecode-verifier-tests/src/unit_tests/code_unit_tests.rs] [Concurrency] Can CodeUnitVerifier::verify_module be called concurrently on the same module, and would race conditions in verification state cause non-deterministic results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-bytecode-verifier/bytecode-verifier-tests/src/unit_tests/code_unit_tests.rs] [Concurrency] Does verification of multiple functions within a module happen sequentially, or can parallel verification miss dependencies between functions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-bytecode-verifier/bytecode-verifier-tests/src/unit_tests/code_unit_tests.rs] [Bytecode edge cases] Can Nop instructions be strategically placed to alter basic block boundaries and bypass max_basic_blocks limits? (Medium)
